member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType
member.summary: The enumeration specifies the type of comparison used in a search.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType.Equals
member.summary: The search results include values that equal the supplied value. If the supplied value specifies a date and time, the returned collection includes objects that have the same date and time.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType.GreaterThan
member.summary: The search results include values that are greater than the supplied value. If the supplied value specifies a date and time, the returned collection includes objects that are dated after the specified date and time.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType.GreaterThanOrEquals
member.summary: The search results include values that are greater than or equal to the supplied value. If the supplied value specifies a date and time, the returned collection includes objects that are dated on or after the specified date and time.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType.LessThan
member.summary: The search results include values that are less than the supplied value. If the supplied value specifies a date and time, the returned collection includes objects that are dated prior to the specified date and time.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType.LessThanOrEquals
member.summary: The search results include values that are less than or equal to the supplied value. If the supplied value specifies a date and time, the returned collection includes objects that are dated prior to or on the specified date and time.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType.NotEquals
member.summary: The search results include values that are not equal to the supplied value. If the supplied value specifies a date and time, the returned collection includes objects that do not include the specified date and time.

The name of the domain or server for context types, the machine name for context types, or the name of the server and port hosting the instance. If the name is null for a context type this context is a domain controller for the domain of the user principal under which the thread is running. The name of the domain or server for context types, the machine name for context types, or the name of the server and port hosting the instance. member.summary: The client is authenticated by using either Kerberos or NTLM. When the user name and password are not provided, the Account Management API binds to the object by using the security context of the calling thread, which is either the security context of the user account under which the application is running or of the client user account that the calling thread represents.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ContextOptions.Sealing
member.summary: The data is encrypted by using Kerberos.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ContextOptions.SecureSocketLayer
member.summary: The channel is encrypted by using the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL). Active Directory requires that the Certificate Services be installed to support SSL.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ContextOptions.ServerBind
member.summary: Specify this flag when you use the domain context type if the application is binding to a specific server name.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ContextOptions.Signing
member.summary: The integrity of the data is verified. This flag can only be used with the Negotiate context option and is not available with the simple bind option.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ContextOptions.SimpleBind
member.summary: The client is authenticated by using the Basic authentication.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ContextType
member.summary: Specifies the type of store to which the principal belongs.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ContextType.ApplicationDirectory
member.summary: The application directory store. This represents the AD LDS store.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ContextType.Domain
member.summary: The domain store. This represents the AD DS store.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ContextType.Machine
member.summary: The computer store. This represents the SAM store.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.DirectoryObjectClassAttribute
member.summary: Represents the schema object that is used to create an object of this type in the directory. This attribute is required for principal extensions and can only be set on classes.

member.name: M:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.DirectoryObjectClassAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified object class value. The object created in the directory will be created with this object class type.
member.param: The string that contains the object class value. The property is initialized to this value. The object class string represents the objectClass attribute for the application directory and domain directories.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.DirectoryObjectClassAttribute.Context
member.summary: This property is not implemented and always returns null.
member.returns: A enumeration value that specifies the type of store to which the attribute applies, or null if no context is set.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.DirectoryObjectClassAttribute.ObjectClass
member.summary: Returns the object class value for the extended class.
member.returns: The object class value for the extended class.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.DirectoryPropertyAttribute
member.summary: Contains the data required by the store to map a principal property to a directory attribute. This attribute is required for principal extensions and can only be set on a property. It must be specified on every property that represents a directory attribute in the extended class.

member.name: M:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.DirectoryPropertyAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the schema attribute name.
member.param: The name of the attribute that is set in the directory. The property is initialized to this value. This property represents the ldapDisplayName for application directory and domain directories.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.DirectoryPropertyAttribute.Context
member.summary: This property is not implemented and always returns null.
member.returns: A enumeration value that specifies the type of store to which this attribute applies, or null if no context is set.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.DirectoryPropertyAttribute.SchemaAttributeName
member.summary: Returns the string that represents the attribute name in the directory.
member.returns: The string that represents the attribute name in the directory.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.DirectoryRdnPrefixAttribute
member.summary: The RDN prefix used to construct the RDN for the new object that is inserted into the store. The default RDN prefix of "CN" is used by the Account Management API if this attribute is not set. This attribute is optional and can only be set on principal extension classes.

member.name: M:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.DirectoryRdnPrefixAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the RDN prefix.
member.param: The RDN prefix. The property is initialized to this value.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.DirectoryRdnPrefixAttribute.Context
member.summary: This property is not implemented and always returns null.
member.returns: A enumeration value that specifies the type of store to which this attribute applies, or null is no context is set.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.DirectoryRdnPrefixAttribute.RdnPrefix
member.summary: Returns the RDN prefix used to construct the RDN.
member.returns: The RDN prefix used to construct the RDN.
